reviewText: I should've reviewed this when I first saw it. Its not a 'serious' horror film and its not a horror comedy either. Its almost like a bastard child of the both of them. You have this guy who's a postal worker who is obsessed with serial killers and wants to be one. But he lacks the cojones. When a real serial killer comes to town, he tracks him down and begs him to be his protege. What follows is very amusing. I am grinning now thinking of a few key scenes that stand out in my mind. OK- I guess its more of a horror comedy than not. I am not a big horror comedy fan. The few I like (and consider actual horror comedies and not campy horror or b movie horror that some people find funny) are: Dale and Tucker vs. Evil, Stitches, and HellBaby. 21st C. is a very easy movie, not demanding on you at all, and its not about effects or anything like that. I really enjoyed it. A 4 in its own class.
summary: Horror Junkie Review: Amusing entertainment. A light night for the junkie

reviewText: 21st CENTURY SERIAL KILLER ... Not alot laughs to die for .To enjoy this film,You just have to wonder..."How Did They Shoot That in public ? "Lots of killing and sordid scenes of how one might get killed and the lack of motivation it takes to kill some one...YIKES !21st CSK is well made and logical ( umm,I wrote that ?) to it's goals of showing a killer training a groupie - wannabee- killer in the massacre arts.Pretty amazing footage and script that is'nt boring and tepid.

reviewText: It's hard to get past the mediocre acting from most of the players.  However an original script and a solid lead performance made it a watchable late night romp.
Title: N/A

reviewerName: The Movie Guy "Movies from A to Z"
reviewText: Aaron Schwartz has a life time goal to be infamous forever as a serial killer. He has a problem. He doesn't like to kill. He has studied serial killers and has used self help books to gain the confidence he needs to kill people. He settles down and marries Erin. When serial killings start to happen in his town, Aaron manages to figure out the identity and become his apprentice.The film is darkly humorous, but no knee slapper. While there are killings, the situation and sound track prevent any real horror.Good for a quirky movie fix. 3 1/2 stars.Parental Guide: F-bomb. No sex or nudity.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Comedy/Horror combos often don't work. I mean, when was the last time a celluloid Killer Clown really scared anybody? So, I repeat: Don't let the cover photo fool you. That photo is just a throwaway moment inside a pretty sharp film. The wannabe killer is psychologically truthful and the serial killer is appropriately sick. The ending fits to a "T" and a good time is had by all. All the sickos that is...
summary: Don't let the Gacy clownface fool you
